Reviews.Title: “Good but the pool dirty”
Reviews.Author: vilrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and beautify. The attention from the employee very nice because they are very polite. The cleanisness of the room it was excellent. The room and bathroom were very clean and the housekeeper keep the room clean all the time and with clean towels. The food is good and have a moderate price. But not a lot a variation in the food. The only bad thing that I will say about the hotel will be is about the cleanliness of the swimming pool. Although is a very big pool and is only 3 to 4 feet tall. Not having the pool clean was not a good experience and the water was very shadow and it look that it need more chemicals. In the morning someone was cleaning the pool but he just clean the sand and didn't put a lot of effort to really clean the water and by 11am when we tried the pool it it was still dirty and with a lot of things floating in the water and the water was very shadow. Overall everything is great and excellent. We use more the beach which was great. And a little far down the beach you can rent jet ski and do some kayaking.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: josvelaz
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel looking for a relaxing time, and it didn't disappoint!! Great service, really Good food, and breathtaking sunsets. The hotel is really pretty and the gardens are really beautiful. The rooms are comfortable, but ours was a bit dark. Overall I highly recommend it and would love to visit it again!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great, but please clean up the beach daily!”
Reviews.Author: SharonH312
Reviews.Content: Exceptional place, a good quiet retreat for a weekend away. Please do have your staff pick up the garbage on the beach that drifts in, there was a lot of it. If they could do that it would be great and environmentally sensitive. But the stay was excellent....

Reviews.Title: “A Sad Decline”
Reviews.Author: MtHopper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Rincon of the Seas two years ago. This time, it was a very different place. The Front Desk staff weren't friendly, and not really helpful. We tried to call to let them know we'd be coming in later, and no one answered, for example. The clerk that checked us out never thanked us for staying with them. The hotel is "tired", and not being kept up well. Weeds in the gardens, chipped tile, and plumbing in our room that did not work well (running toilet) were some of my observations. They didn't provide face cloths with the linens, which I didn't like. The music at the pool was "Techno latin" which drove me nuts. I couldn't sit at the pool for long. These little things all added up. On a positive note, our room was quiet and comfortable, and clean. The hotel is situated in a convenient location, and has a pool with a swim up bar. They made a terrific Cubano sandwich. We have agreed that we will probably look for a new place to stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “They need training”
Reviews.Author: Ball441n
Reviews.Content: I checked in under a groupon rate I purchased last month. Upon check in asked the lady at front desk for an upgraded room and I would pay the difference. Front desk agent said no upgrades available hotel is 100%... Which was weird to me considering we arrived on a Monday and spring break not yet for P.R. Needless to say there was about 40 people in hotel... Hotel needs training on upgrade fundamentals. Food and beverage was fine it's just service that u need to go through ;( Common sense is lost in major way! example: my 7 yr old child wanted to feed the little fish on the property. After spending at pool nearly 150 on food and beverage! my waitress who I tipped more then 15% wanted to charge me for little piece of bread! This lady lacks the big picture of business and is stuck on stupid for real ;) Probably not go back

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: adrest
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to PR and loved how easy it was to get to the hotel from the airport. the location on the beach is fantastic (the best feature of the property) and the pool with the swim-up bar is amusing. the gardens were quite lovely. get a room on the second floor or higher but away from the bar/pool - they play pumping techno in the late afternoons and early evenings, which gets overwhelming after two hours. the rooms are so-so. my biggest complaint is that the floors were always slippery and grimy, the bedspreads/curtains looked like they were from 1982 and the little polyester blanket on my bed had holes in it. the breakfast was pretty bad (except for the omlette man who was ok). on the plus side the sheets and towels were nice and clean, as was the bathroom and there was plenty of secure free parking. the staff was friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Staff Ignorant of What Hospitality Means to PR”
Reviews.Author: FBarillas
Reviews.Content: After a grueling day of sports and activities my kids and I were starving - but not for fast food -so we decided to go to this resort. We went directly to the pool bar area where we were informed that the restaurant was closed and that the only serving area was the one around the pool. We sat down, several of the staff waiting saw us and even locked eye contact with us, but not one of them approached us for almost 15 minutes. It was as if they were purposely walking far from our table and the table next to us full of tourists. We left to the Lazy Parrot Inn where we had a great time. The poor tourists stayed since they probably had no idea where to go for service. We might has wasted some time but in the end free market justice set things right. The resort did not get my purchase and given that I am a local, they also lost my future purchases because it will be a long time before I give them another chance. But the tragic thing is that the tourists will probably - and justifiably - leave with a poor impression of PR and its hospitality. They will tell their friends and maybe even go as far as leaving a review here. And see, for all of us living here in the island, that is a big loss. There are plenty of other places that will show you a good time, serve you well, and provide excellent value for your money. This is not one of them unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view through the palm trees”
Reviews.Author: japjv
Reviews.Content: If you pay for an ocean view ask for a room on the fifth floor...the fourth floor rooms are partially blocked by the palm trees....the grounds are great and the restaurants provide decent food at a reasonable price....but for the price it was a great deal....In Rincon you don't have to pay all those crazy taxes they levy in San Juan! All in all I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: maddiehawaii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a friends wedding. This place is just ok. The beds were fine, but the towels were very thin and old . The bathtub/shower had rust all around it. The maids did not get the sand off the floor any of the days we were there. The food at the breakfast buffet was horrible looking so we walked down the street to get pastries every day. The lunch food tasted good but the choices were very limited and unhealthy--chicken fingers is haute cuisine here. Luckily We never ate dinner here due to wedding events. The upside is that the beach is nice and there are plenty of beach chairs and more crappy towels. If you want to be in Rincon, which I question, this place may be the best option in the area...but it's not great or luxury by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience so far!”
Reviews.Author: Robotboss
Reviews.Content: We stayed close to Saint Valentine Day looking for the perfect atmosphere. Nothing fartest from that...there was no hot water on the tub. We raise a complain to front desk and they called the maintenance people. They never came because the water was never hot and because we told them to check the safe box also and they didn't. So we ended up paying for a room with no hot water. We asked for a room change and they offered a room with full bed insteadof the king bed we had. So it was a matter of deciding from having cold water at the tub or sleeping uncomfortable.... We also bought a bottle of wine and we went to front desk twice asking for a corkscrew...guess what? They didn't have one. We were told to ask on the pool bar and guess what again....they couldn't remove the cork because we didn't purchase the bottle on their bar!!!!!!!! We went for the third time to front desk and finally they gave us a cork screw.

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bonito Hotel / Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kma29
Reviews.Content: PROS- Muy bonito hotel. RomÃ¡ntico y familiar a la vez. Tienes todo cerca: playas, buenos restaurantes, etc.. CONS- La piscina es mÃ¡s bien para niÃ±os, no es mas alta de 3 pies. ENGLISH-------------- PROS- The hotel is very nice. Romantic and familiar at the same time. You have a lot of places very close: restaurants, beaches, supermarkets, etc.. CONS- the pool is more for children, does not exceed 3ft tall.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Janet M
Reviews.Content: I went there with a special offer coupon wich was worth every cent. I arrived almost an hour before the scheduled check-in but they gave me the key inmediately, no aditional cost. The room was clean and cozy. It was on the third floor. We didn't have phone wich made it difficult to communicate with the staff. The ice maker machine didn't worked properly. They must have a few not just one. Wi-fi worked perfectly in the whole property wich was great. Staff was always available, always helpful, they even opened the hotel store for me given I left my bathing suit back at home accidentally. At the beach, employee providing the chairs was very kind, I made him move my chair several times. At the bar the staff was amazing, they created a warm, joyful atmosphere. My drinks by the pool were always cold and ready. Food was delicious. Breakfast was a little overprized but the service was worth it; they have buffet but also prepare several things to order. I wanted to stay one more night but they were full. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property; subpar rooms”
Reviews.Author: Roe44
Reviews.Content: the property is beautiful and well-maintained. The staff attentive and responsive. Free coffee in the am was a plus for me, but no other coffee available during the day, so you have to go to the bakery down the road. Great location right on beach with sunset view! I love everything about this hotel except the rooms. The room smelled musty and the floors were dirty. I actually cleaned the floor myself with Lysol wipes. The beds have those old 1970-ish bedspreads and bedskirts which really grossed me out and the bottom of the bedskirt was dirty. It is such a beautiful space, it's a shame the rooms are so outdated and icky. If anyone from the hotel is reading this, you must update your linens, pillows and get rid of those awful bedspreads and old amoires. Other than that, I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ana T
Reviews.Content: The beach is great: long and with fine sand. It is safe for swimming. The hotel provides beach chairs in case you want to relax in the beach. The hotel is clean and the service was very good, fast and customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “First class property with theird class services and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mbk_10
Reviews.Content: This is a first class property located in a beautiful beach. Unfortunately, the service is atrocious and the amenities are third class. 1.We had to wait 30 minutes at check-in since the two attendants were busy â€œtyping lettersâ€�. 2.The hotel room smelled like cheap car air freshener and the room phone didnâ€™t work, so we had to switch rooms. 3.There were no beach towels available. 4.During dinner, nobody knew what the age for the childrenâ€™s menu was, so after a group consult; they assumed it was 10 or 11 years old. 5.The food was good, but the waitress didnâ€™t know the difference between wine brands and wine types. 6.The beds, pillows and linens are very cheap. 7.The music in the grounds is too loud and of bad taste. 8.They called for a wake-up call 20 minutes late! Probably they pay their employees very little and they don't train them properly, In any event, since the price per room is on the high-end ($150-$200), tourists that go there will not return. Unfortunately, I predict that Rincon of the Seas will probably end up bankrupt and hopefully a big chain like Hilton or Sheraton could take over and manage it properly. In the meantime, avoid this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Momohat
Reviews.Content: When I think of our visit to Puerto Rico I see us at Rincon of the Seas. We had traveled around a lot and stayed at some 'rustic' places. Our welcome here was friendly and came with a key card to check out a room before deciding to register. We stayed on the 3rd floor next to a really peaceful and beautifully appointed shade and fountain garden in back, pool and ocean off the front balcony. It was quiet, clean and lovely in every way. We were offered a package that included a very tasty full breakfast both mornings - the staff remembered which omelet we ordered - and a $25 coupon for dinner in their excellent, 'white table cloth' restaurant. Here the service was top notch as was everything we ordered. I was very aware of the architectural design, hall furnishings, colors, and landscaping and asked about who designed it. It is an island artist and architect, Jorge Oliver, Isabella. I would highly recommend this hotel. We were there pre season which may account for the quiet and the attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool/beach...but underwhelming "resort"”
Reviews.Author: DenverDevos
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the pictures online and were referred to it from someone living in Aguadilla which is just north of Rincon. When we got there, we were unfortunately underwhelmed. It is actually the biggest resort in Rincon, but don't expect a 4 or 5 star resort! The employees are pleasant and helpful (when you can get ahold of someone) but the overall feel of the place was just ok. The room was just cleaned prior to our arrival (in fact we had to wait for it) and it was apparent that bleach is the cleaner of choice! The blankets/sheets were questionably clean and I had to hunt throughout the entire hotel for plastic bags for the trash cans. The pool was nice, with a great (little) kids section only a foot deep. The "continental" breakfast is decent if it's included in your room. Which I found out was just more expensive if you buy it with the room! Definitely not worth $10 a person considering it's bagels, toast, fruit and deli meat. The lunch menu at the pool bar is decent but overpriced. The chicken quesadilla is great, good fruity drinks, and the bartenders speak English which was helpful. We were there in early Dec (wed-thu nights) so it was very slow! I think they had 4 rooms booked in the entire place and we had a hard time finding staff at times. Overall it's definitely the "resort" of Rincon. But don't expect much as Rincon is very small and "remote". Could be an expensive trip if you stay a while! There are several small "hotels" and guest houses available as an alternative option. I met the owners of Dos Angeles Del Mar guest house and they are WONDERFUL! John and Yolanda (originally from Jersey!) were so helpful with information, directions, recommendations for restaurants, and even first aid after I split my eye open surfing! They have a very nice home and pool in the hills of Rincon. We will be staying with them next time! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “First visit.....mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: Jfbravo
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rincon of the Seas. At the front desk there was a sign posted that they had ran out of beach towels. After check in, we settled into our ground floor room. The A/C unit in our room was loud and there was a lot of humidity (the floor was wet). There's TV and cable service but the channels available are very limited. The pool and the pool bar area was very nice, and the staff was friendly. The grounds are well kept. They serve a very nice breakfast buffet. We only stayed overnight so I will return and hopefully get a better perspective of hotel. In my opinion this is a 3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: farm2fork
Reviews.Content: Pool is fun and drinks are good. Nice beach front with plenty of places to lay and tan. Wine bar has okay selection but nothing too spectacular. Food at restaurant is pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - on the beach”
Reviews.Author: crackerpacker
Reviews.Content: Although it is an older resort, it is kept in good shape. The staff was responsive to our requests and were very courteous. It is a nice location with direct access to the beach - a great place to view a nice Caribbean sunset! There is a nice pool, pool bar and beautiful tropical flora. I would recommend this hotel if you enjoy a more quiet and comfortable location over a busy casino property.

Reviews.Title: “A little local information”
Reviews.Author: abraxasPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to point out a little mis-information in some of the reviews. I have lived in Rincon for 7 years and often take visitors to Rincon of the Seas for lunch. I have never stayed there, so I have no opinion on the rooms. Some of the reviewers recommend going to Rincon Beach Resort as an alternative. That may be a very good idea for the people who prefer resorts. The town of Rincon doe not have any facilities that I think qualify as a resort (although Rincon of the Seas is probably the closest) However, you should know that it is not 'a mile away'. In fact, it is not even in Rincon, it is in Anasco. Their name was a marketing decision. You will not be on the same quality of beach nor near any of the ambiance that makes Rincon an attractive destination. My experience with Rincon of the Seas has been very pleasant for the most part. The food quality is good. The service is friendly but can be very slow. It depends on who is working at the time. The pool is great for those days when the ocean is too rough. I have never found the pool area or the pool bathrooms to be anything other than very clean. Their breakfast is more expensive than places like Burger King or EC Bakery, but in my opinion, it is much higher quality.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with beautiful grounds and excellent sunset views”
Reviews.Author: Jess379diaz
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to make reservations at the hotel after reading some of the other reviews, but I am glad I did! I stayed in suite 201 and was pleasantly surprised. It is very spacious! It has beautiful views of the Caribbean Sea and the pool areas! The pool has a great pool bar and the drinks are good! They had music on Saturday which was nice! The sunsets are beautiful!!! It is an overall nice hotel!!! Don't expect 5 star resort and you will be happy! As for the air conditioners when we first got to our room it was too cold, but we lowered the temperature and we were very comfortable!!! And our room did not smell of urine! It is a great getaway!!!

Reviews.Title: “Discusting dissapointing rediculous place smell like urine”
Reviews.Author: Moro1101
Reviews.Content: This place needs a makeover from top to bottom .the rooms are like twenty dollars rooms. The service sucks and smells terrible dont ever try to stay there especially with kids. The website shows u everything beautiful and dandy but in reality trust me is plane old moldy smelly and sucks .

Reviews.Title: “we did love the place and next time we will come back with our kids”
Reviews.Author: marilennys v
Reviews.Content: I LOVE LOVED LOVED THE PLACE, I WENT WITH MY NOW FIANCE AFTER THAT FIRST DINNER UNDER THE STARS :)) . The restauran had great food, the attentions and service was great. Everything was done as plan for out package. we will come back, and for you all that want to visit Rincon this is the best and nices looking place to stay in. We went around to see what we saw and i told my fiance this was the best place we could have chossen to stay in, He agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: esrun3122
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing rooms, from decor, old furniture, humidity in the room is terrible, customer service is poor and not willing to accomidate. Very expensive for nothing, please consider Rincon Beach Resort nearby. Stay away from here if you want to have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad service at Pool Bar”
Reviews.Author: lillil72
Reviews.Content: This resort is a very beautiful place, and the view is great. When we got to the Front Desk there was a long line and it was very hot, I think instead of a lamp hanging over the line there should be a fan. The first thing I did after checking in I went to the Pool Bar, after a 2 hour drive I was looking foward to a very cold beer, I sat at the bar for 15 minutes while the Manager and his bartenders where just talking. There was no eye contact at all, when at last one of the bartenders past by I called him and he told me to give him a minute and he never came back. I then waited another 5 minutes and then another bartender came to me, at last I got my beer but it was hot, I finished the beer and then waited a while but there was no service at all so I ask for my check and left. While a sat at the bar I also notice that the pool had no filter working and the water was very dirty, I stayed for 3 days and all of the days the pool was the same way. The pool is the most attacking area and it is a shame the service was so poor... As for the rooms, the maids where excellent and everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rather go to Rincon Beach Resort next to it.”
Reviews.Author: BadHotelExperience
Reviews.Content: The air conditioners are old and don't have the capacity to cool the room. I complained and they replaced the unit by another old unit that could hardly blow any air into the room. The bathroom was dirty. The floor all over the room was sticky and you could feel the dirt on your feet. There were napkins and plastic cups around the yard on the way to the pool and the beach. Finally, after 3 hours I had to live the hotel with my wife and they charged me the night. I drove 1 mile to Rincon Beach Resort and got a better deal, a clean room with a good air conditioner, a better place in all aspects and a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: wluz
Reviews.Content: Its a good deal for staying in Rincon, still it needs more marketing for things happening in Rincon, and pampering of hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mochocoly
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior looks nice and tropical until you get to the Front Desk. The front desk staff is not friendly and the room is overpriced for what it offers. The room is small and dated. Bathtub was rusty (disgusting ) as well as the lamps. Only one end table. TV was old and had poor reception. Has a mini fridge but no microwave. Could not even warm leftovers. We had no washcloths in our room from the first night and housekeeping was lucky to find couple of them but when we return them for clean ones we were told they were out. The towels are old and stained . The elevator was very slow and the first night did not work. Went up to the 4th floor but could not go down .The only nice people at the hotel are the restaurant staff. They are very nice and the food at the hotel was delicious( try the Churrasco and the Paella if you're only in the area to eat ). NO fitness Center .... I will never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “was so-so....”
Reviews.Author: KDel73
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rincon and decided to stay here. Front desk women werent too friendly. They are not too customer service friendly. Room was just ok, nothing spectacular. Little expensive considering it was an average room and there wasnt breakfast included. Room had a fridge which was good. Had a balcony which was cool. Pool was great, Pool Bar service was SLOW!!!! Beach and sunsets were beautiful. They need to update their towel service for Pool. You get the towels at the front desk and often there werent any. I would probably look around for other places to stay next time I go back. They also dont have a lot of amenities like an ATM, Internet etc. If you stay here, dont expect too much although when I told many people I was staying there, they were like, Oh nice.... But it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible business practices”
Reviews.Author: MoreDistortion
Reviews.Content: Became really sick the night before the arrival, had to cancel (unless they wanted someone in there with a stomach flu). They kept the entire amount of my night stay. Not a refund, nada! How desperate are they that they needed my money, without providing a service in exchange? I would never, ever, do business with them or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “so-so, at best”
Reviews.Author: mrsbev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rincon of the Seas for 1 week late November/early December 2010. Overall, it was fine but I wouldn't rave about it to others. Our rooms were nice but nothing special. I did enjoy having a balcony and a fridge in the room. The staff members were nice, but certainly not overly eager to help. Apparently, we went during slow season, which I think gave us a less impressive experience. For example, during our entire stay the internet was down and never fixed, the restaurant was closed, the wine bar was closed, the gift shop was closed, etc etc etc. My biggest gripe was the music at the pool bar - it started around 11am and went until dinnertime each night. It was loud, bad, and just plain annoying. It made it very difficult to relax by the pool, and you could even hear it all the way at the beach - incredibly annoying. Also, they chain the beach chairs together, so you can't really move them around to where you want to sit - also annoying. That all being said, the pool bar has the best mojitos ever! Absolutely delish (although overpriced). Food was good - great cobb salads and burgers/sandwiches (although again, overpriced). Breakfast was lacking at best - they have a buffet and like to let you think that spending $14 on it is your only option. It's not - just ask for the a la carte menu. Coffee at breakfast is free - that was very nice! In general, I would absolutely recommend a vacation to Rincon! I went with my husband and 2 friends, all of whom are surfers, and I am not. The beaches are gorgeous though, and I was happy to just lay out while they were in the water. Nightlife is fun and there's plenty to do. We did happy hour at Calypso a few nights - it's an absolute must if you go to Rincon! Shipwrecked was great for dinner (get the mofongo!!), as was Pool Bar, Tamboo Tavern, and the tapas bar at Casa Islena. Rincon Tropical (right across from Rincon of the Seas) was great for authentic food. As another reviewer mentioned, there is a supermarket within walking distance, too. I would recommend renting a car in Rincon - most beaches and restaurants are driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: LaoTou
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable, the grounds are beautiful, and the beach is gorgeous. The restaurant menu is excellent. Too bad the chef can't handle it. The food is overcooked which may explain why service is slow. We were there over Valentines day. Wanted to have a nice dinner in the restaurant but it was closed. "You can get the same menu in the pool bar." Give me a break! We really did not want to have a romantic dinner in the bar with its uncomfortably loud music. The internet outlet in our room was at least 10 feet from anyplace you would put a computer, but the front desk lent me a 20-foot cable. The hotel doesn't have laundry facilities but there is a laundromat across the street. There was a refrigerator in the room. A coffee pot would have been nice. There was a great mirror in the bathroom but no light over the mirror. The ceiling light was behind my head and my face was in shadow. All the rooms are on the same side of the hotel. "Ocean view" rooms are high enough to look over the trees. Lower rooms are "garden view." We were on the ground floor and the garden view was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Valentine's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Viajeros2008Caguas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Rincon of the Sea to celebrate our anniversary and for valentine's day and it was perfect!!!! The views (the beach and the pool), the service, the room and the food were perfect!!!! The hotel is clean, the room are spacious and all rooms have view to the pool. The "Jardin Botanico" is very beautiful too!!!. We can't wait to our next vacations to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable island getaway from the States”
Reviews.Author: rebanyc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Rincon of the Seas. Everyone who worked at the hotel was incredibly friendly. I was very pleased with the location of our room - I booked a Beach Cabana room at a discounted rate on hotels.com and the back door to our patio opened right onto the pool area and was only steps away from the beach. The room also had a mini fridge in it so we drove over to the Econo grocery store (you could also easily walk there) and picked up snacks and drinks to keep in the room. My only complaints about the hotel were that the entire time we were there, the room phones didn't work and neither did the internet. I didn't mind so much but I had friends in other rooms who were trying to keep up with work and you couldn't even call for room service. Also, the rooms and garden could stand to be be updated but for the price and proximity to the beach, I was happy to spend the weekend at Rincon of the Seas! I never ate at the restaurant at the hotel but we had a rental car so we could easily get around to other restaurants and bars in the area. Parking was free at Rincon of the Seas. The pool area was very nice and we spent more time there than on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: docchilie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for two nights around 1/20/11; no bedbugs as of that date. I agree with others review that the hotel rooms are a bit dated, but completely disagree with using that as the total assessment of this property (i.e. why are you in your room, and especially why are you watching television?). The property is well grown in with tropical trees, making the setting especially beautiful. The beach is viewable from the higher story rooms. The pool is very shallow, with a swim up portion to the main outdoor bar. The outdoor bar is very nice, with friendly staff, and food from the restaurant. I never went into the restaurant, so I cannot comment on ambiance, however the food is excellent (get the coconut tempura shrimp). Just to the South is the Villa Cofresi, which will have the nightlife this place may lack. I cannot comment on value, as I have no idea what I paid a night due to being here for business. I would definitely come back here on my own dime with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “You need a vacation after staying here”
Reviews.Author: infmaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty. The staff surly. The television stations were nonexistent or pure static. The gym is closed. The only good thing is the location and the proximity to the Villa Cofresi, which has ammenities that exceed Rincon of the Seas, at half the price. In addition, the staff at the Villa go out of their way to make your stay memorable. The staff at Rincon of the Seas should take lessons from the Cofresi staff. Rincon of the Seas should pay guests to stay there, that is how bad it was.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice but could be excellent with a little updating.....”
Reviews.Author: Stoat71
Reviews.Content: i do not agree with some of the bad reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel was clean and safe. The hotel has excellent location on the beach and gardens and landscaping are wonderful. The only ciriticism i would make is that the rooms and parts of the the hotel could do with a little modernisation. Rooms are fine but a little 1990's. TV choice is limited and there is no wireless internet. Also hotel should have more staff - at times the restaurants were closed. Whilst this might be becasue of lack of customers. no customers are going to go a restaurant that always seems closed. The gift shop was also never open or only open if the staff reception specially opended it. Despite above critcisms, the location is fantastic and view were excellent and room rate was surprisingly cheap. Definately value for money and good hotel for those looking for a bit of quiet. Not a 'hot spot' for place to go fot the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: matiro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in october 2010 and had a great stay. The food and service was really good. If you want to swim in the ocean off the beach the water is warm but the current may be formidable so we went to a few other beaches within driving distance. The Staff was friendly and helped us find things places to explore. I would go back. we stayed in a top floor ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is horrible, By the hour hotels in the hood are better.”
Reviews.Author: bewareofhotel
Reviews.Content: There are no deluxe rooms. The floors are dirty, there are bugs everywere, the floors have a humidity dampness to them, the light fixtures are rusting, the sheets are stained and they had no hot water, so taking a shower to wash their dirty room grime off us was not an option. We stayed one night and checked out the next day. We tried to switch rooms 3 times but they were all the same. I asked for the room from the internet pictures, but was not available. When we left all our belongings were damp, any paperwork we had was wet from humidity. Staff said that this is the tropics and they can't get their floors clean, but the next hotel we stayed at had clean floors, no humidity dampness or bug problems. I spend half my life in hotel rooms and this place was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The price is way to high. this room should go for about $29.99 a night, tops. The internet site is false advertising and im not sure who have given all the good reviews, unless you live in an outdoor grass hut with mud floors.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful veiws”
Reviews.Author: jburger037
Reviews.Content: checked in without a reservation and got a room with a beautiful view of the pool, ocean and sunset. restaurant was nice...good food and service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - not luxury but nice qualities”
Reviews.Author: paulandsarahthomas
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, but is very nice - great beach, close to town, loved the frog chorus at night. Check in and check out were a bit slow. And breakfast was not the greatest. But we had a very nice stay and were glad we were there. Many Puerto Rican families, which was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “OUR WORST NIGHTMARE!!!!!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marilyn415
Reviews.Content: We decided to renew our wedding vows at Rincon of the Seas. The wedding was beautifull we had a great time. However our nightmare started the day we checked out I realized that my birth certificate and social security card along with my husbands and my six children where stolen from our room. We spoke to someone at the front desk they where very unproffesional unwilling to help us to find out what had happened to our indentifiactions, they refused to write a report. They would'nt call the police so that we can make a report. The hotel security guard had to call them for us because no one in that hotel wanted to help us. We had tried to get in contact with administrative and the owner of the hotel and until this date no one has responded to any of our calls they are very unproffesional and are not willing to help us. PEOPLE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL THEY DON'T CARE ABOUT ANYBODY BUT GET INTO YOUR POCKETS WE SPEND SO MUCH MONEY IN THIS WEDDING AND IN RETURN WE GET OUR IDENTTY STOLEN!!!!! No one knows anything and they have no clue what to do or where to go when a situation like this happens. The staff there are not very friendly nor helpful. My husband calls this hote "motel" THE FLINSTONES. What ever you do, DO NOT stay at RINCON OF THE SEAS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nana019
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights during a weekend in may. We had a wonderful time. The food and drinks were great and very reasonable priced. The beach and surroundings were excellent. Room was fine. There were lots of people at the hotel, but that did not interfere with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: eponaaries
Reviews.Content: This hotel had exceptional service. Checkin was a breeze. We had an unexpected upgrade to partial ocean view. The grounds and gardens were lush. The rooms were super cute and clean. I appreciated the refridgerator in the room. Very nice to have cold drinks when you return from a long day at the beach. The courtyard walkway from the hotel to the pool area was great. I loved all the greenery and flowers. The only things that I thought were a minor inconvienence were: The pool was shallow and just for wading only about 3ft deep. The beach chairs were chained together. I understand that this was to keep the chairs at the hotel property. However, it was impossible to rearrange the chairs to sit in sun/shade ect or spread out as they were all in a line. Hotel might need to reconsider unchaining the chairs during the day and then relock them at night. Resturants: Had the buffet breakfast one day at the Hotel. Dinner at Tamboo was great. Loved listening to the surf and enjoyed this little beach bar. Dinner at Harbor Resturant and sat under the pavillion right on the beach. Food was great!! Trips: We booked the Tropical Trail rides near Isabella and had a wonderful ride along the beach and jungle. Both of us are accomplished riders and the Pasafino horses were beautiful and resonsive. Nothing beats cantering along the beach while hearing the sound of the surf. My daughter had a surf lesson with Puntas Surf School at Maria's beach. She had a great time. The surf was pretty high at times. We ventured out to the waterfall near San Sebastian. Gozanlandia. I had GPS coordinates to get there otherwise I would never have found it!! The waterfall was beautiful and there were no tourists there!! yeah!! Just a couple local families enjoying their time together.

Reviews.Title: “A Low-Key Resort in Rincon”
Reviews.Author: MtHopper
Reviews.Content: We don't like resorts. But the other alternative in Rincon is very small B&Bs, which can be a problem if you're not of like mind with the other guests. So, we chose a resort, and held our breath. It was absolutely lovely, with beautiful landscaping, excellent service, and down-to-earth vibe. There were lots of local families there for the weekend when we arrived, as it was a long weekend in PR. The pool and beach were busy, but we didn't feel like it was crowded. And there was no resort "attitude". The location was excellent, too, as it's right outside the heart of Rincon, with easy access to other restaurants and beaches. It was very convenient to get to. This was truly a wonderful find for us, and we would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!!!!!!! STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!! RUN!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paget333
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we had to stay here. We drove from San Juan, about a 2 hour drive. Some nice views, nothing spectacular. Upon arrival in Rincon, it seemed like a cute little town. We almost drove past the hotel, because the signs are so small. A WORD OF ADVICE, THERE IS NOT MUCH TO DO IN THIS AREA! WE DROVE 15 MINUTES TO SEE THE RINCON LIGHTHOUSE, IT WAS 50 FEET HIGH (SERIOUSLY). THE LIGHT HOUSE PARK HAD NICE VIEWS, THIS PART I RECOMMEND. ROUTE 413 (ROAD TO HAPPINESS) WAS A JOKE. THERE WERE 5 SURF SHOPS, AND NOTHING ELSE BUT A RIDE THROUGH THE MOUNTAIN. Check in- Had to ring the bell on the counter for service. There is almost always no one at the counter. The staff is nice. Don't expect a bell boy, you must take your luggage up yourself. Lobby is nice. Room- Early 90's Art Deco. SMALL! The lamps all had rust spots on them, as well as the patio furniture. Various rips and tears on the sheets. There was only one nightstand, so I had to use a stool that was in the room for one. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. Oh, my Ocean View room, was barely that. It is only Ocean View when the wind blows the palm trees to the right, and you angle your body, and strain to see the ocean. Bathroom- The bathtub finish was peeling away, so every time you took a shower, there would be paint chips in the drain. The shower curtain didn't even close all the way, there was a gap of about 10 inches. Dining- Over priced and mediocre at best. Bar- Good service and drinks. Pool- Small and shallow. Beach- Not private, nothing spectacular. The only reason why we stayed here was for a wedding, held on the beach, which was surprisingly nice. I should have followed my gut instinct, and stayed in San Juan, and stayed here for the night of the wedding. We drove a great deal, but there really nothing in the area that is worth seeing. My advise, go to an all inclusive in Mexico, you will have a better time, and get your money's worth and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but not sure worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: jblake111
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were a little less expensive, i would have better things to say about it. But being one of the pricier hotels I saw, the expectations are higher. The Rooms: Could use a remodeling. Blankets and sheets seemed old, the furniture as well. Old clunky TV with channels that didnâ€™t work very well. Outdoor seating on patio very old. Roomed seemed more fit for a nice motel than a hotel. View from balcony of ocean was very nice and overall the room was quiet. Fridge, but no ice machine on the floor. Overall clean, and quality soap/hair products. The Beach: Small but nice. There are lots of beach chairs, but they don't regulate who can sit in them. We saw lots of people just coming off the beach or who were obviously not staying there, utilizing them. As in, people who show up with their own food/drink. This is a bit annoying when you want a seat or because you are paying much more than them to enjoy the same thing. The Service: The folks at the outdoor bar (there isn't an indoor bar) were very nice and helpful. They gave us advice on things to do, were friendly, the food was good, and the prices were very reasonable. They were the highlight of the hotel. The Pool: No Jacuzzi, but clean, decent size, heated. There are also seats in the water for the pool bar, which is cool. Overall it was filled with kids most of the time we were there, which doesn't do it for me. The Location: Right near downtown Rincon, not far from the Marina, the surf beaches, other hotels, etc. Good spot. Next time I go to Rincon, I will most likely not stay here, but me and the gf had a great time overall, so I cannot argue with that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Loriellei
Reviews.Content: We have traveled throughout PR, but this was our first trip to Aguadilla/Rincon. Hotel of the Seas was a great place to stay: tranquil, clean, beautiful beach, great location-accessible to all that Rincon and the west coast have to offer. Some recommendations: if you fly into Aguadilla, rent a car from Charlie's (they have a 24 hour counter at the airport); bring a beach towel from home as clean beach towels do not always arrive at desk in the morning; if you are with a spouse/partner, request an oceanview room on the 5th floor; walk/drive to area restaurants for meals (Rincon Tropical is right across the street from the hotel with great comida criolla and there are great seafood restaurants heading south on 115 with amazing views); if you go to the surfing beaches of Rincon, go to Tamboo for lunch (disappointing for dinner) only if you want a typical American lunch while watching the surf but definitely go to Casa Islena (on the same road as Tamboo) during happy hour (3 - 5) for some great tapas. We were there for 4 days- not enough time to do all that we wanted to do. We will definitely return to this hotel and use it as a home base for day trips to Camuy, La Parguera, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: DELTRAV
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in 2006 and it was great at the time. Now, it clearly has deteriorated and I agree with other reviewers that no money has been spent to keep and improve this hotel. The floors were dirty, as well as the walls. The bed sheets looked old and with stains. The shower curtain had mold, as well as the shower walls. The tub kept backing up and by the time you were done in the shower, it looked as it you were taking a bath and not a shower (ugh). The Pool was kind of nasty in some areas, with crap from the cats that live nearby. The free breakfast was very basic, with basic cereal and breads, but the "upgrades" were not expensive.. but paying $225.00 for room that is not clean, I would have expected a NICE breakfast, for free, like what we had 4 years ago!! The bar was closed at 10:00-- so if you want a drink.... plan on drinking early! Now, the good part... Rincon--the BEST sunnsets---AMAZING.. the location of this hotel would make it the ideal vacation if the issues were fixed.. Rincon is close to Mayaguez, Cabo Rojo and others, where there are lots of things to do...

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon spectacular”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMN86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at Rincon of the Seas, and we could not tell you how special it was. The rooms are very clean, and the ocean view is spectacular. We drank mojitos and watched the sunset from our balcony! Rooms are clean and nice, but nothing super fancy. There are several reasons you will want to stay here: 1) Ammenities The pool bar was delicious and always had bartenders, the pool was clean and had very few people and always open beach chairs, and the beach was steps away and gorgeous. 2) Location Steps away from Villa Cofresi for great dinners and happy hours, close to Sugar chef for great ice cream, walking distance to grocery stores and bakery. The only places you probably need to drive are The Spot for lunch and the Lazy Parrot for dinner. 3) Privacy Villa Cofresi was packed, Rincon of the Seas was not. We felt like we had our own private vacation, where we could choose if we wanted to have peace and quiet at our hotel or lively bar scene just down the beach. **If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not necessarily the place for you, but if you want a romantic and wonderful spot, this is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: viajera00771
Reviews.Content: The rooms where clean, the gardens where beautiful, the pool and wetbar where just very relaxing. The brakefast buffet was nice but the eggs where cold I found it expensive... The shallow pool was very nice for keep an eye on my 3 year old girl without getting wet ;) At saturday night they had a dinner buffet at the pool area and live music it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Name, Grand location, but not Grand hotel...”
Reviews.Author: laristain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend (Nov. 2009) for my cousinâ€™s weeding, and there are few things I would like to point out. First of all, It is too expensive. They have a $500 per weekend which only includes two breakfasts, which by the way, were ok. Do not expect a grandeur room; it is just a standard room, with not too comfortable beds not too nice bathtubs and not to cool air conditioners. For $500 a weekend, I expected a plasma TV, but all they have is an old type TV, with weird red push buttons on it. The pool is ok, with a nice wet bar, but you have to request the pool towels at the front desk and they charge a $15+tax charge for deposit per towel, which are credited when you take them back to the hotel lobby, so do not get them too wet, because you will be dripping all the way back to the hotel lobby, otherwise, pay the $15 fee. The hotel does not have a gym. They also have a nice ambiance on Saturday nights with a nice local group. Since I went for a wedding, the ballroom, and the food in the wedding were excellent, as well as the service. Being a large group with different size budgets, other than the wedding night, we choose to eat outside the hotel, for a cheaper tab. Hotel is appropriate for families with kids, or a romantic getaway, as long as you stay out of the room. Maybe, if they had an all inclusive program, it might worth the money, otherwise, not.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with family and/or friends”
Reviews.Author: rbrown333
Reviews.Content: this is my first time to Puerto Rico and I came for a wedding at this hotel...it was the perfect location and the group had an amazing time...highlights: pool bar, breakfast buffet was great., ocean view, steps from the ocean, lounge chairs in the sun and shade both by the pool and on the beach, food was excellent, free parking, alternate food options accross the street, kayak and jet ski rental not at the hotel by steps down the beach...transportation: would recomend flying into Aguadilla airport and renting a car from Charlies... the town of Rincon and Aguadilla were very quaint...if you fly into San Juan it takes about 2 - 3 hr. to drive on the toll road...

Reviews.Title: “lovely hote;”
Reviews.Author: mrsp2007_9
Reviews.Content: I live in Rincon in the winter months and have stayed at this resort and also go there all the time for lunch. It has a lovely open lobby and many nights they have live music. The food is very good and the swim up bar is great! It's on a lovely stretch of beach and close to other bars, restaurants, grocery and liquor store. For the people who complained about the mosquitos... um hello? they tend to have those on tropical islands especially in the summer months..bring bug spray.

Reviews.Title: “I did not like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: soul29
Reviews.Content: The lobby and restaurant is old and dirty. The only good thing is that the staff is polite. Needs renovation and cleaning, and insect exterminating (mosquitoes).

Reviews.Title: “Exuberant!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Candy16
Reviews.Content: Rincon of the Seas is more than a hotel... is a wonderful sanctuary, just awsome. As soon as we arrived we noticed the warmth and welcoming service of all the employees, during our whole stay every employee we walked by greeted us and smiled. Excelent service. The front desk staff is very accomodating and willing to answer all your questions and help all the way. Since we got a great deal ($99 dollars a night) with breakfast included and a $50 dollar credit in Food & Beverage, we stayed five days (mon - fri). We noticed that during weekdays there are less guests, so you have this great feeling of privacy, as if you had the place all to yourself. The hotel has a great Hindi - Tai decoration motif, you will see a lot of carved wood furniture, statues of Shiva, Kali and other Hindi staples. All so beautiful. It gives you a vibe of peace, very Zen. By all means pay extra for the ocean view rooms, it makes a great diference, rooms with ocean views are in the main building, floors 4 & 5. (We got room 521 (see the pictures), it had a fabulous view, even from the bed I could see the ocean. If you get a room on the side wings you will face the courtyard. The good thing is that since the hotel has a lay out of a "U" all the balconies look inwards so there is no parking view, or garbage deposit view, the worst view you could get is a huge palm tree right in front of the balcony. Rooms are clean and comfortable, this is not a luxury hotel, so you wont find much amenities in the room, there is no coffee maker,however ther is a mini fridge so you can buy snacks and keep them there, no mini bar, no internet in the rooms (there is Wi-Fi in the lobby but it reached my room in the main building, I'm not so sure about the rooms in the side wings). There is no pay per view, just regular basic cable, which is fine with me, who comes on vacation to watch TV ? Another thing is that they leave two extra bath towels for you to use at the pool, there is no pool stand so you have to take the ones they leave at the room and bring them back with you to either let them dry in the room or call to have them replaced.The room it self was in very good condition, housekeeping was very attentive with us, always left extra towels and soap, even friendly notes. Close to the resort (maybe two blocks away) there is an Econo supermarket where you can stock up on everything from beer to ant type of food and keep it in the mini fridge at the room. The food at the hotel is very good,a little less expensive than the food of hotels in the San Juan area. The portions are massive, the Cobb Salad is great and is big enough for 2 people so be careful when ordering, for example, we ordered a fajita trio dish which comes with a plate of tortillas and plate of grilled chiken, skirt steak and jumbo shrimp. My husband and I ate till we were stuffed and there was still enough for two more persons. And the dish just cost $11 dollars. *** Tip: 1- Take advantage of the "Day's Special" for $14.95, it includes soup of the day , house salad, and the entree thats on sale that day. 2- The Room Service Menu is the same as the restaurants, but they charge you gratuity plus a service charge for delivey, instead you can call the restaurant or the pool bar, order, and pick up yourself, so you get to save some good money.**** We had dinner one night in Deco, the signature restaurant of the resort, it was great, the service was awsome, we had a Seafood Asopao ( spicy soup) just perfect, and we tried the Pork medallions in passion fruit sauce, it was excelent. You gotta try the pecan cheesecake, heavenly!!!! On another night we did the "Dinner under the Stars", for $125 dollars, you gotta reserve ahead. It was sooo romantic, they set a table for you right in the beach,decorated with flowers and candles, very romantic music, and they prepare for you a very special three course dinner while you drink champagne or wine and see the sunset or gaze at the stars. We reserved after the sunset so we got to look at the stars and enjoy the full moon. A must do if you are on your honeymoon or aniversary!!! The beach area is very nice, there is jet ski rental for $55 dollars and Kayak rental for $11 dollars. In the afternoon you can sit at the beach and watch the most romantic sunsets, the pool is big but shallow, around 3 feet, 4 feet near the swim up bar. It was very clean and was open since 8 am. Since its summer there was a camp for kids, everyday they had surfing lessons in the pool for kids 6 to 10 and at the beach for older kids. There's a playground for kids right in the side garden.There is also a game room open 24hr. My husbsand and I dont have kids but we went a few times and had fun. On weekdays there is really no nightlife going on unless you have a car and go out, there is a movie theather 15 minutes away, several restaurants, bars and pubs also are close by. During the weekends the hotel has a wine bar that features live music, kareokee and salsa lessons. I dont understant other reviwers who take their time to complain about silly things,and spend their precious vacation time complaining about everything. why come to a hotel to look under the beds, under the sinks and swipe your fingers under every nook and cranny looking for something to complain about? Vacation is about fun, relaxation, about leaving it all behind . I will definetly recomend this place to everybody, It may not be as luxurious as the Caribe Hilton in San Juan but it sure beats them in value,quality and most of all in Guest Service. We already reserved for next summer, cant wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: PacoPepe1
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely needs a renovation, it appears that not one dollar has been invested since its opening. The floor in the room was dirty, as well as the tub. The air conditioner must be replaced as well as the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY IF..................”
Reviews.Author: pimptown
Reviews.Content: I thought that staying by the sea would be a great relaxation after a hard day of work. I opted to check out both the art deco room and a standard room. The regular room was horrible..it was unkept and look like a room from the 1970s..... However, if you opt for an art deco room, it is a spacious as an apartment with wonderful views ask for room 101 it was the best!!!!! It came with its own private yard (hammock included) and private access to the beach. The room was $400 or something approximately like it but well worth.... but much much better than the standard rooms. Please do not try the in room service or the resturant at the hotel...it is not worth your money!!!! The local resturants are much better and there is a super market around the corner from the hotel. The grounds of the hotel was very nice and the beach was wonderful....The hotel rooms needs renavations...badly.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Western Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Marsha14057
Reviews.Content: Last April, my husband and I spent 5 days visiting Rincon of the Seas. The hotel is beautiful with the grounds similar to a mini botanical garden, lush with exotic plants and flowers. The rooms are clean and quiet (although the air conditioning unit was a little noisy). We had room with a balcony where we could have coffee in the morning and a glass of wine while we enjoyed the beautiful sunsets. The lobby is opend to the air and the hotel is decorated with ornate furniture obtained by the owner during his world travels. While the pool is small, the beach is quiet and great for swimming. The staff is professional and friendly. Kevin, the front desk manager, was especially helpful and cooperative, giving us a tour of the gorgeous suites that are available. We had previously stayed here in February when we were able to view migrating whales from the beach and attend a professional surfing competition at a nearby beach. Rincon itself is a very laid-back small town with not much night life, but wonderful restaurants and gracious citizens. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an authentic quiet beach getaway at reasonable prices..

Reviews.Title: “problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: seanachie
Reviews.Content: I would not be so critical of this hotel were it not for the price. It was about $100 more expensive per night than any of the surrounding properties, most of which looked equal to and some superior to the Rincon of the Seas when we toured them. On the positive side, the staff is friendly and helpful. The main desk people were nice and the housekeeping crew were outstanding. The room, and, in fact, the whole hotel were spotless. The pool was clean and nice, but only deep enough for a kiddie pool. The beach was great with plenty of chairs. Housekeeping provided a lot of fresh beach towels. The 5th floor oceanview room had a spectacular view of the sunset, and a good large balcony, however I had to fix a drainpire with a coke can so it wouldn't flood the balcony. The room was small with not enough surface space to put all the stuff that one spreads out for an 8 day stay. Only one side of the bed had a night table. The furniture was servicable but tired and certainly never high end. The linens were okay at best. The bathroom was all right, but again tired and the tile and fixtures were not what one would expect at a hotel as expensive as this. Both ice machines and one of the two elevators were broken and never fixed during our stay. You had to trek to the pool bar at the other end of the property to get ice. The bartenders at the pool bar were incredibly busy doing things other than serving the customers. I once tried to order a drink when there were only 4 people at the bar. The other three already had a drink. There were 4 servers behind the bar who were extraordinary at avoiding eye contact and not hearing your order. When one finally came up to take my order, she apologized and shrugged as to suggest that she was so busy. I looked behind me to see if 30 more people had snuck in, but no, the same four thirsty souls. Perhaps the worst was the fact that there was a wedding at the hotel and the wedding party had the rooms on both sides of us. They commenced to play loud music and talk and laugh loudly at 10 pm, cranked up the decibel level at midnight, and started screaming at 1 am, which they continued until two or three am for three consecutive nights. There was no response from the front desk when I asked that security be sent to at least talk to them. They said they would, but the noise continued unabated. In fact, I can't say that I ever saw a security guard at any time while I was there. Many guests had similar experiences as ours. One couple, who were on the 3rd floor, thought the screaming was a terrorist attack, and they were figuring out how to protect their children when the desk told them it was only a wedding group. There were rumors that the hotel was about to change hands, so maybe the management is just hanging on until something happens. All in all, I would have to say to keep away from this place especially at the prices they charge. Rincon is a great place, but the Rincon of the Seas is not the way to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: sacha555
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend of October 31 thru November 4th. The first night I arrived late (around 10pm) to check in and when I got to my room, I could not get to sleep because they had out loud music playing (reggaeton) until 12 am. The same repeated next night. There were lots of dust on the room, the air conditioning filter was very dirty, you cannot walk barefooted because your feet would get dusty. The internet (wireless) was unstable at the room, (I could just stay connected for 5 minutes and then the connection fell and I had to keep on trying to connect). The bathroom door had the lock missing and the balcony door handle broke (when I opened the door the handle was left on my hand). There are no pool towels at the pool area, so they leave one towel per person. One of the days, they came to clean the room and the pool towels needed to be changed and they told me that they did not had any towels until after 1pm (it was just 10 am). The bathrooms at the pool area were out of service. The pool was very dirty (I did pass long times at the pool area with my daughters and I never saw any personal cleaning). The pool was full of plants, sand and dead bees. The pool pumps were not working fully, I could check this myself (just few jetstreams were working). I did not let my daughter stay at the pool long, as I was afraid of the bacteria (I never saw anyone dropping clorox or netting the pool) The food is very expensive. The bar was closed during election day (no service at the pool whatsoever) I had to go out to get food and drinks. Horrible, I would never come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quite and Peaceful -”
Reviews.Author: pedrodo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we choose this to be the place for our honeymoon and I have to say I feel satisfied with the service and prompt response to any requested service. We stayed for a total of 4 nights. Although the weather did not cooperate at all this, didn't ruin our special stay at this hotel. We had a little problem with the AC the first day and it was IMMEDIATELY fixed for a brand new equipment. The Staff is VERY nice and servicing. The pool is awesome. Do not expect much from the beach. The view and sunsets are to die for. You definitely get what you pay for. Watch out with food prices within the hotel!!! we found them exuberant. Although the food we tried was one of good taste, portions and looks. We stayed at the fifth floor, our room had a good size balcony with a breathtaking sea view. If you really want an ocean front view MAKE SURE you get on this floor because anything bellow is packed with palm trees blocking "the view". It has a gym but we never check it out. Same with the game room. Satellite TV worked fine until a storm came( which I considered totally OK). Even though I didn't take my laptop with me, I didn't see anything relating to wireless internet or so around the hotel. I have to mention that the best food you will find at the Italian restaurant just outside the hotel. I believe its called " el bambino". try anything! their food quality, presentation and prices are excelent! I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quite, please, modest stay with your partner or family.

Reviews.Title: “mama bear- just right”
Reviews.Author: revreggae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 3 properties all next to each other. One was rather spartan and too quiet- only one other couple there. The other was packed with 20-somethings. Subdued spring-break energy made me claustrophobic, although obviously that's what a lot of people are looking for. R of the S was just right. Enough going on to not be bored but quiet enough to relax. Steps from the beach, pool and swim up bar very nice, very nice garden area underutilized by guests. If you want to do little, at the hotel or in the area, a great place to stay. If you are used to all-inclusive bevy of activities or multiple options of excursions in the area, you will grow antsy after a few days. Walking down the beach you will find many homes, condos, etc. falling apart or unrepaired seemingly from a previous storm or hurricane. R of the S itself, however, kept up their grounds very well.

Reviews.Title: “Ask twice if you want something done”
Reviews.Author: MiBo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week. As a vacation property, it's a nice place. As a business hotel, it has issues. If you find issues, be prepared to ask twice to get them fixed. On my first night, my air conditioner didn't cool the room enough. In the morning, I asked to have it fixed. That day, it wasn't fixed ("they went home early today"). That evening I tried three other rooms until I found one with a fully functional A/C. There are no coffee pots in the rooms (so you'll buy coffee in the restaurant). I said I want a coffee pot, since I leave for business in the morning before the restaurant opens. It didn't arrive after the first day, so I insisted and it arrived for the third day. They send out laundry (a real feature), but only if you insist ("why wasn't laundry picked up today?" "I don't know, we'll send it out tomorrow"). Evidently, laid-back vacation spots are not high-performing business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “As a hotel - 9 out of 10. As a hotel on the beach - 7 out of 10.”
Reviews.Author: V_Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Great beach front property, but under utilized. Unfortunately this place turned out to be a pretty typical hotel. With a location like this I was disappointed to see that the design of the hotel and gardens interrupted the views of the beach from the pool and from most of the rooms. The only rooms that seemed to have a good view only offered one bed. The room I ended up with was pretty small, and it looks like most of the rooms are, and had a view of palm trees 5 feet outside our balcony. Maybe that is all you get for $190 a night these days..? If you don't mind being a 10 minute drive from everything in town (Agua) and you are just looking for a hotel without all the service and amenities of a resort, then this place may be okay. Most of the locals sounded impressed, so it may be the nicest for the area.? For me their section of beach was too small with no drink service, which made it hard to relax, and their pool had no view. :( On a good note, the staff was very friendly, the food was good, and the gardens and lobby were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: luissanJuan
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four (two teenagers included). we stayed there from Wednesday thru Friday. In overall the hotel was good,nice lobby, rooms, grounds ...is exactly like you see in the photos. The pool was nice and clean but shallow ( only four feet deep). The beach was very good, with a long stretch of sand to walk and enjoy the ocean view, lounge chairs to move around as you please and take a suntan or get under a palm and relax. The only thing is to bring water shoes as you may encounter rocks in the water. The only negative thing I would say about my stay is for the food. The breakfast and lunch was included in our package but the menu for this deal is limited. The breakfast was buffet style (limited) and since it started at 7:00 a.m. by the time it was 9:00a.m. the food was cold and the drinks warm. As for the staff the front desk and housekeeping were exuberant (as they called it), also the noon staff at the pool bar. The rest of the staff were simply courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Day Care Center”
Reviews.Author: SOLESURVIVOR
Reviews.Content: First the good. The hotel lobby is beautiful, the landscaping is beautiful, in fact the only location where we heard the coqui, the famous frog of Puerto Rico. The breakfasts were very nice. Now the bad. We were promised a beach view room. What we got was not beach view, but tree view. We took pics of all the palm trees, etc. that were the"beach view room". Interestingly, the room next door did have a beach view, the trees were still below the balcony, why didn't we get that one? We were also very tired from the drive and wanted to relax with a drink by and in the pool. The pool area was over-run with kids. We tried to sit by the pool and" our moment "was interrupted by a kid trying to climb the palm tree next to my chair. Needless to say, totally unenjoyable. I'm sure it was for the parents and their kids, afterall it was a day care center, free baby sitting area. They didn't even try to curtail their kids. And of course, the staff said nothing to them. We moved and went over to the bar, hoping at least kids won't be running around over there. Well, the music was extremely loud, the bartenders went out of their way to ignore you, and yes, kids also came over to the bar area. Such fun!!! The only peace and quiet we enjoyed there was at dusk on the beach in our lounge chairs, away from the hotel and its noise. If you stay there on the weekend a band plays music loudly til 10 or 11 pm, so be prepared! I complained to the staff over the phone about the kids over-running the pool area, and asked if there is an adult hour for swimming. She laughed and said we have families here, and no there isn't an adult swimming time. So, I guess kids rule at this hotel!!! BE FORE-WARNED! I also complained to Hotels.com about our not getting an ocean view room hoping to get a refund or at least compensated some how, NO SUCH LUCK!!! AGAIN A WARNING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and homey, but not Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: panicbutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during the Presidents' Week holiday, so we expected it to be very crowded, which it pleasantly was not. The lobby was lovely and gave the feeling of a larger, more luxurious hotel. Glad to have a small game room in the lobby with a great air hockey table for my teenager. The pool is lovely and large, and usually no problem finding a chair. The beach was okay with only a few chairs. The beachfront area in front of this u-shaped hotel was small, but you had a lot of beach to walk on on either side. There were other small hotels to the left and a water sports rental place not far that had jetskis, banana boat rides, kayaks, etc. (but no sailboats). The beach was ordinary, with some waves and water more dark green, like the Atlantic. Rooms were ordinary, clean, of the Holiday Inn type of decor and size with a small balcony. The hotel has a sweet courtyard with a kids swings area and a garden with lots of hammocks and a couple of picnic tables for shady napping or reading - a nice touch. Good service at the front desk and by housekeeping. The gift shop was never open; nor was the wine bar in the lobby. Room service got most of our orders wrong. The room comes with free buffet breakfast, which was fine for free - the usual stuff, eggs, breakfast meats, greasy potatoes, some fruit, yogurt...but very good coffee. Not sure if I'd stay in the same place when I come back to Rincon. I'd probably want to stay in a funkier, smaller place near the surfing beaches or one of the paradors to get more local culture.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: The_Leske_Gang
Reviews.Content: The good. The hotel is well maintained, clean, with pleasant grounds, a nice large (albeit shallow)pool, nice poolside bar, and an excellent location on one of the best beaches in Rincon. It really is very nice. Oh, and the sunsets are to die for. The Bad. Get your reservation confirmation in writing as they are not above changing the deal prior to arrival. It took quite a bit of effort (even after booking in June for New Years) to get a written confirmation. The "Beach Cabana" rooms are not cabanas at all but simply ground floor rooms of the hotel. When we discovered this, we asked to be moved and were promptly found a room on the third floor. The views from the balconies are pretty much non-existent except for maybe 10 or 15 rooms at the very ocean end due to palm trees which have grown so tall and lush as to blot out any view. If you like palm fronds, you'll love it. The air conditioning units blow hot air right on to the balcony so there is no sitting on the balcony while the AC is running. By morning, the balcony is very warm, too warm to enjoy. Noisy. It seemed there was a wedding every night, and loud music was constantly blaring. At one point, there were two receptions going on at the same time and the resultant cacaphony at 10:30 pm was enough to rouse me to complain, twice. A real drag. The Ugly. The food service was abysmal. The breakfast buffet was fine, lunch extremely iffy, once you got it which was often 40 or more minutes. The dinners provided with the meal plan were really bad. Whatever you do, don't get a meal plan. There are a lot of really great places to eat in Rincon, enjoy them. The Bottom Line. If you are looking for a resort style hotel with a big pool and swim up bar, this is the only game in town. And the kids will love it! All the kids I saw were having a blast. Would I go back? Maybe, but only because I am armed with the knowledge I have now and wouldn't be so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jesslee1906
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rincon of the Seas for my honeymoon and it was the trip of a lifetime. We were ecstatic to find our hotel after the 2 and a half hour drive from San Juan. When we first walked in we were struck by the grandeur of the open air lobby and the antique furnishings. Also, the front desk staff was very helpful. Our room was acceptable. The bed was comfortable and the balcony was a nice touch. The satellite TV was on the fritz so we didn't get many channels but we weren't in the room much anyway. The main restaurant was not open but the open air restaurant was very nice. I think we ate there 4 times during our stay and didn't get tired of the food. Rachel was our waitress and she happily answered all of our questions no matter how stupid they may have been. Also, we got the complimentary breakfast. The breakfast could have been warmer but I think if we had gotten there a little earlier it probably would have been. The pool bar was fantastic. Jose, the bartender, was very friendly and prompt with our drinks. (he makes a great martini by the way) The beach was lovely. There was a little erosion due to the recent tropical storm but that didn't stop us from enjoying it. We did some swimming and some sunning. But mostly we spent the evenings out there, watching the sunsets (which are AMAZING!!!), listening to waves and the coquis and drinking daiquiris. Also, the landscaping was great. Beautiful trees and beatiful flowers. We did spend one morning lounging in the hammocks. The hotel was great but I recommend that you don't spend all your time there. Get to know Rincon. Take the time to explore the crazy hills and winding roads. The beauty of this place will not disappoint. Also, everyone in this town is laid back and friendly. I recommend that you make the trek to the Americanized area of town and check out the surf and the surfers. The waves were HUGE when we were there. (Oh, and the lighthouse everyone talks about, "El Faro", it's not much to look at. The natural scenery and beauty outdoes it BY FAR!) As for the local establishments: We visited a restaurant called Angelo's for dinner one night. We got all dressed up and headed out, only to be quite disappointed when we pulled up. The restaurant didn't look like much from the outside. However, when we went in, our outlook changed. Flowers on every table, beautiful furnishings and Angelo himself was our waiter. Check out the Angelo's specialty. This place could not have been more welcoming and the food, well it just doesn't get any better than this. We visited Calypso for lunch. Great steak burritos. Again, a fabulous atmosphere and a wonderful view. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Also, be sure to visit the Tamboo Beside the Pointe. This is one of the most amazing bars I've ever been to. Again, it was the laid back atmosphere and the friendliness of the staff that made me want to come back again and again. The food's good too and the drinks are CHEAP compared to the hotel! It's a little hard to find but as they'll tell you in Rincon, every road goes to the same place. Keep driving and you'll find it!! We were there in the off-season so we didn't have many other tourists to contend with. I can't speak for the high season but as far as my experience goes, if you like seclusion, relaxtion and friendly people I would definitely recommend Rincon and the Rincon of the Seas. I know we plan to go to back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mrsm2007
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rincon of the Seas for four nights. The hotel is very clean and the staff is amazingly accomodating and friendly, but the hotel is certainly not a 4 or 5 star hotel. We are frequent travelers and my husband I agreed that the staff was probably the friendliest and most helpful staff of any hotel. The rooms are quite tired and dated, but since the hotel was so reasonably priced, and breakfast was included, we were not unhappy with our stay. The beach is lovely, as is the pool area, but the strap chairs are quite worn and need to be replaced. It was pretty quiet when we were there, which we were very happy about, but were told that it is the off season and it is much busier from November on. If you are looking for a low key, rather inexpensive resort, then you would probably be happy with this hotel. If you are looking for luxury, this is not for you. It is a great place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mynsanchez
